intro: Anthospermum albohirtum, commonly known as white-haired anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Anthospermum albohirtum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
